title: Kaley Cuoco says she and husband Karl Cook have 'no problem' with living separately
text:
She shocked fans when she admitted she and husband Karl Cook don't live together as they are waiting to move into their dream home.

And Kaley Cuoco has insisted the couple have 'no problem' with residing in separate homes as she shed light on their 'unconventional' marriage.

Speaking at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic event in Los Angeles over the weekend, the Big Bang Theory star, 33, revealed she and the equestrian, 28 - who have been married for 15 months - are 'taking time with everything' as 'life is all about balance'.

Unconventional: Kaley Cuoco has insisted she and husband Karl Cook have 'no problem' with residing in separate homes

The TV and film star said that while the pair are content with living in 'different locations', they're definitely looking forward to moving into their new abode.

Kaley told Extra!: 'We're not at 14 years yet but I think you have to give time about everything, life is about balance.

'It’s great — we are building our dream house, so we’re gonna be in our home together very soon. But as of now, it’s worked out fine for us. I have no problem with it!'

The longtime animal lover also revealed they're both managing to look after their pets, despite their unconventional situation: 'We have a lot of goats right now and a lot of rabbits but the rabbits keep multiplying, not sure why!'

Candid: Speaking at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic event in LA over the weekend, the Big Bang Theory star, 33, revealed she and the equestrian, 28, are 'taking time with everything'

Exciting times ahead: The star said that while the pair are content with living in 'different locations', they're looking forward to moving into their new abode (pictured in January)

On his equestrian career, Kaley added: 'He had a big win recently, we were so excited! He's had a really good show year, the sport is up and down.

'There's a lot of high highs and a lot of low lows so when it's going well, you got to really grab it!'

Last month, the actress revealed the couple currently live at 'different locations' and don't spend every single day together.

She told E! News: 'We are building our dream house, we are going to be under the same roof forever.

Different: 'It’s great — we are building our dream house, so we’re gonna be in our home together very soon. But as of now, it’s worked out fine for us', she shared

'We have a very unconventional marriage, you know, we have different locations that we are at a lot. We are not together every single day.'

The media personality said that their way of living works for them and joked it means the pair can 'Instagram shame' one another easily.

She added: 'I think personally it's important and it works well for us. If you want to Instagram shame each other, Instagram shame each other. It just makes life really fun. He loves Instagram posts, he's his biggest fan.'

Meanwhile, in June, Gwyneth Paltrow, 46, defended her to decision to not live with her husband Brad Falchuk, 48, during their first year of marriage, although they are now making the move.

She said Brad only stays with her for four nights a week, spending the rest of the time at his own house.

Speaking to the Sunday Times Style Magazine, the actress said the couple's friends think their unorthodox set-up is 'ideal'.

Everyone's (not) doing it: Gwyneth Paltrow and Brad Falchuk decided not to move in together during their first year of marriage to make things easier for their kids

She said: 'Oh, all my married friends that the way we live sounds ideal and we shouldn't change a thing'.

Brad previously told the WSJ: ‘I’m moving in September. We’ve just done it slowly. Divorce is terrible, even when it’s the right thing to do. And it’s really hard on kids.

'Come September, we’re all gonna Brady Bunch it up, and it’ll be great.’

Gwyneth also told InStyle: ‘Married life has been really good. We took a year to let everybody take it in and let the dust settle. And now we’re moving in together this month.'
description: The Big Bang Theory star, 33, has insisted the couple have 'no problem' with residing in separate homes as she shed light on their 'unconventional' marriage.
